newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai B shares end down despite rate cut.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai B shares end down despite rate cut.

text.p: Shanghai B shares closed down on Friday after two major listed firms posted worse-than-expected interim results, despite the bullish news that the central bank had cut bank interest rates, brokers said.
The index fell 0.331 points or 0.63 percent to 52.029 points, on volume of 10.3 million shares worth $5.1 million. Of 41 B shares, 35 traded, with 14 down, 16 flat and five up.

Six B share firms posted their interim results on Friday, including Shanghai Shangling Electric Appliance which reported a fall of 53.26 percent in net profit and Shanghai Yaohua Pilkington Glass which reported a drop of 61.55 percent.
Brokers said that the fall in net profits of these two blue chip stock brought down the whole index.
Shanghai Shangling fell $0.022 or 4.15 percent to $0.508, on volume of 23,300 shares. Shanghai Yaohua followed, down $0.024 or 4.10 percent to $0.560, on volume of 95,900 shares.

"Investors were more interested in firms' interim results today than the rate cut which had already been partly digested over the past few days," one broker said. "But the market will benefit greatly from the rate cut in the long run."
The central bank announced on Thursday a cut in bank despoite and lending rates by an average 1.5 and 1.2 percentage points respectively as from Friday.
"The index will consolidate around 52 points next week, with investors waiting for other interim results due by the end of this month," a second broker said.
Shanghai Goods & Material was the biggest loser, falling $0.012 or 8.95 percent to $0.122, on volume of 17,000 shares.
Eastern Communications traded the most, thanks to institutional buying of stocks listed this year. It ended flat at $0.800, on volume of 2.5 million shares.
Shanghai A shares fell as the news of the interest rate cut had already been digested, brokers said.
The index closed down 15.428 points or 1.80 percent to 840.226 points, on volume of 320.3 million shares worth 2.8 billion yuan.
The SSE 30 index fell 19.100 points or 0.90 percent to 2112.968 points.
Shanghai Yaohua Pilkington Glass was the biggest loser on sharp fall of its net profit, plunging 1.57 yuan or 13.99 percent to 9.65 yuan, on volume of 1.1 million shares.
